intro: Pseudoseris rutenbergii, commonly known as the Rutenberg's false seris, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
